item.title: [HBASE-13413] Create an integration test for Replication
item.description: We want to have an end-to-end test for replication. it can write data into one cluster (with replication setup) and then read data from the other. The test should be capable of running for a long time and be reliant even under chaos monkey testing.
item.summary: Create an integration test for Replication

Hopefully I'm paraphrasing correctly, Enis Soztutar's policy on branch-1.0 is things don't go in if not in the bug fix bucket. However, I believe we should (if are not already) treat test tooling and release eng differently than user facing changes. I think we'd want to be able to run this IT for subsequent 1.0.x patch releases.

Hopefully I'm paraphrasing correctly, Enis Soztutar's policy on branch-1.0 is things don't go in if not in the bug fix bucket.

Yes. I think it is not just my policy, but a policy that all committers should stick to for more stable and predictable releases. I really hate point releases where some random improvement breaks something which gets fixed two point releases later, etc. With semver and current release line-up in branch-1 series, it is relatively very easy to upgrade if a user wants to pick up new features.

However, I believe we should (if are not already) treat test tooling and release eng differently than user facing changes.

Yes. Test improvements should go in regardless whether they are bug fixes or not. More tests = more stable release.
